task_summary: Detect, approach, grasp, and slightly lift the red object located near the table center-left.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator must pick a red upright object situated among several cans and bottles on a curved white tabletop. The robot first perceives the target, opens its gripper, moves to a safe height above the object, aligns top-down, computes a grasp, executes the grasp, verifies that the object is held, and lifts it slightly to confirm pickup. The sequence assumes unobstructed access from above and uses conservative timeouts and moderate gripping force to avoid knocking nearby items.
preconditions: Red object present on the tabletop and not occluded
Gripper functional and initially able to open
stepwise_plan: Retry detection of the red_object until it is confidently visible.
Open the gripper to a wide aperture.
Move to a pregrasp height above the target.
Approach and align top-down within tight tolerance.
Compute a top grasp pose and move to it.
Close gripper to secure the object.
Verify object is in gripper and raise it slightly.
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: automatic retry via decorator
If alignment fails: re-detect and re-approach
If grasp slips: reopen, re-align, and retry grasp with same strategy
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful verification and lift of the red object.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive the red object with a retry wrapper for robustness.
Go to a safe pregrasp height above the object.
Refine approach and align for top grasp.
Compute top-down grasp pose and store on blackboard.
Move to the computed grasp pose.
Close gripper to grasp the object.
Lift the grasped object slightly to confirm pickup.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to lighting or occlusion
Collision with adjacent items during approach
recovery_strategy: Back off and re-align if contact detected unexpectedly
Reopen gripper and reattempt grasp with same top strategy
Increase approach timeouts if repeated near-misses occur
assumptions: “red object” refers to the tall red rectangular cylinder near table center-left, consistent across frames.
Top-down grasp is feasible without contacting neighbors.

expected_success_criteria: CloseGripper succeeds and ObjectInGripper is true
